title: Rwanda Bill: Rishi Sunak insists Tory party 'completely united' as letters of no confidence go in
description: The UK Government passing its controversial Rwanda Bill appears, on paper, a clear win for the Prime Minister. Following the Boris Johnson playbook, he warned the House of Lords must not “frustrate the will of the people”, adding it was time to “take back control of our borders”. His eggs are all in the Rwanda basket and it could break very easily.

title: Full list of General Election seat forecast for Bristol - Tories headed for colossal losses
description: The Conservatives are being forecast to lose three out of five MPs they currently have in the Bristol area in the next General Election, according to a new model. YouGov found that Labour would win a large majority were the election to be held now, with Keir Starmer sitting on a 120-seat majority.

title: Rishi Sunak's Rwanda bill branded 'unworkable, hugely expensive, and could break international law'

Scotland’s equalities minister is also accusing Rishi Sunak’s government of abdicating from its international and moral responsibilities over this legislation.

title: A red in every sense, Sir Tony Lloyd was a pillar of Greater Manchester politics - and a staunch campaigner for justice for its citizens
description: Sir Tony Lloyd, who has died aged 73, was quietly spoken, always sharply dressed and had a long political career. He was the first - albeit interim - Greater Manchester mayor in 2015, a post he held for two years. The roots of his political passion lay in the Spanish Civil War of the 1930s.

title: Tories hit polling low not seen 'since Liz Truss’s time in Downing Street'
description: THE Tories have hit a low in the polling not seen since Liz Truss’s final days in power. A new survey from YouGov predicted Rishi Sunak’s party would win just 20% of the vote. Keir Starmer’s Labour polled at 47%, a 27-point lead. YouGov said it was the largest lead for the party since Truss’s short-lived time in power.
